conclusion: To determine the maximum distance between the two vehicles, we need to analyze the braking process of the truck and the bus based on their respective v-t graphs.
The v-t graph of the truck shows that it starts braking at 10 seconds and continues to decelerate until it comes to a complete stop at 30 seconds.
The v-t graph of the bus shows that it starts braking at 20 seconds and continues to decelerate until it comes to a complete stop at 30 seconds.

premise: Truck: Initial velocity: 40 m/s, Final velocity: 0 m/s, Time: 10 s
conclusion: Distance traveled by the truck = Initial velocity × Time = 40 m/s × 10 s = 400 m

premise: Bus: Initial velocity: 30 m/s, Final velocity: 0 m/s, Time: 10 s
conclusion: Distance traveled by the bus = Initial velocity × Time = 30 m/s × 10 s = 300 m

premise: Truck has traveled 400 meters, and the bus has traveled 300 meters.
conclusion: The maximum distance between the two vehicles is 400 meters - 300 meters = 100 meters.
